content: One of my favorite mobile games of all time. I read a lot of reviews complaining that the game was really grindy, but what they also fail to talk about is how the grind allows you to mold and develope your characters like a true RPG. Compared to Battleheart 1 I would say this game is a beautiful upgrade. Better graphics, character progression and faster paced combat. What more can you ask for?
So terrible compared to the first game. On its own, really cool, just absolutely outshone by the other two games.

I played the original and this is nothing like it. This game is awful. You have to grind to get experience. Or you can just have your heavy hit all the enemies and have them run around the field because no one can catch him. But that takes forever as well! This game is so dreadfully boring. The original was great. How did they mess it up so badly!

So far it has pretty good gameplay and all, but why remove the tavern music though. Was such a good part of the first game, went fighting and then when it's done you're welcomed back by smooth tavern music. Now it's just pumping epic music constantly. On another note, why change the character system? It's so boring now that you have everyone unlocked, way more fun to feel like you've earned them. Literally a tavern before, you need to purchase heroes, just like in any other game or story.-.
Black screen on start with poco f2 pro phone
update : doesn't work on my xiaomi mi 10 phone. Only showing black screen after "mika mobile" start screen. Please fix this, thank you
Classic game, but dated. Wish this franchise didn't die out. Alas. I want more of these games
Totally worth the little bit of money it costs. Non ads or in app purchases. Lots of fun!
Has bad glitch. Will let me download but not play.
Awesome game for 2 player
Really good game. I played the original battleheart a decade ago. This one has different graphics, much better gameplay, a ton of simple fun. Definitely recommend.
It needs more characters, could you add a male wizard like in the first game
The loading time is way too long. This is a critical problem and really need to be fixed.
Boring, trying to like it. It but I just can't

It's surprisingly really fun. I play this with a friend of mine and we have a blast. It's a simple play style but can be more complex when it comes to upgrading skills and team combos. Would give it a 5 star if there was a bigger variety of loot and characters to choose from and if the legendary items were a different color so you could tell them apart.
Awesome
Very repetitive with too much emphasis on grinding - progression just isn't rewarding
There is a big where the game just disconnects on multiplayer
Game is unplayable in multi-player...
Yet another masterpiece. Don't forget to turn on advanced interface.
One of the best mobile games I've ever played. The only downside. Is that after you beat the campaign. There isn't much more to do. I hope they make another.
It's a really pleasant sequel. i wish there was more updates
Need to create a cloud save so if you reinstall again, don't have to start all over again. CBA playing for days just to get back to stage I was at
The game is great. Hope for a part 3
This game really let me down. I was so hyped for BH2 because I really lived the last 2 games but this game is just a grindy reakin of BH1.

I don't mind the game despite basically being just a series of endless grind battles. I do mind that there's no auto attack, though. The absence of auto attack is why it's 2 stars. I had more fun with Battleheart Legacy (there's auto attack and targeting there)... well, before the very sudden and inexplicable spike of difficulty of the last boss battle.
Take long time to load and need to be fixed and it a great offline game
游游땏游땥游땢
Good game. I don't know though, somthing about this is lacking the greatness of the first game..
Mind blowing sir. 游뗺 But i want more.

The battles and character progression are very satisfying, for one, because the heroes stats don't scale up too fast like crazy. I don't like the fact that you can choose an infinite number of missions until you decide to face the boss level. This freedom adds to boredom. Finally, there is no actual multi-player. The game could at least show a list of rooms for us to choose from. That's disappointing. Still, one great game on the store

I enjoy the fantasy theme and character abilities. However the interface needs a smidge of polish just to fix the issue where if two characters are very close to each other, clicking on the one you intended to in a pinch (such as endless mode) is half likely to end in a miss-click and someone dying. This game is ruined for me because there is no account link of any kind that I've been able to find. You can spend 100s of hours grinding gear, if you take a break, you start from 0. Shaking my head

I absolutely love the game. The grind pays off, the battles are intense with every wave and very satisfying. I recently bought this and started playing co-op with my friend. However my concern is that during match ups he sometimes loads in late and causes a big to appear. This bug causes him to be unable to see enemies, or Target them. Since I'm doing support with cleric and Knight and he's doing damage with pyro and rogue I can't kill them. Please fix this I will 5* after. Thank you!

Nice reboot of the original. Mechanics have been improved: builds are more customizable, can choose type of rewards when grinding, store/equipment/talents are all quickly accessible from the same screen. Levels are party based instead of character based, instead of grinding exp you grind skill points, this makes it easier to explore new characters without your party becoming unbalanced. The way level/area selection is presented obscures my sense of making progress. Lacks updates.
Fun to play

Not nearly as expansive or as enjoyable as Battleheart 1. The characters don't matchup, and some can hit max level after two rounds of combat, which is approx 10 minutes compared with the hours of enjoyable discovery of new powers and characters in the first game.
This game deserves more updates. Yeah..
What rpg?

Battleheart 1 has been my favorite mobile game for years, and one of the few reasons I mobile game at all. Battleheart Legacy a close second. Battleheart 2 falls short for me though. Party level sort of fixes the problem of characters falling behind, but not really. Now the skill points take a long time to get. Why can't I replay bosses? All the fights are very easy and a long grind. I rather enjoyed the difficulty from 1. Where are the arenas from 1? Pretty dissatisfied after wait.
Love it
Very nice game
Very good game. But no Cloud save, otherwise 5 stars
please more content!
Fun game

This really is an awsome little game.. it has a fair bit of depth while also being simple and not to head hard游땖..best tip..dont run for 4 player team straight up.. working now on 'dark' team, witch, vampire and necromancer..maybe thief for 4th hero?..游뗵 thinking maybe priestess, monk and knight should make excellent 2nd team
Great fun game and good value for money. Well recommended.

Little grindy but since the gameplay it 100% and no microtransactions, the artwork is fantastic - for a mobile game this is exactly what a mobile rpg should be - heaps of classes, heaps of skills literally replayable to death to get all the items, but honestly not as good as battleheart legacy - still 5 stars from me tho

I was a huuuuge fan of the first battleheart and was happy I could support the devs by buying the 2nd one. Unfortunately it feels extremely grindy. Although it is kind of the same as the first, in the previous entry you had clear stage progression and character level meant something as it was tied to character skills. In battleheart 2 all I do is grind 3 differrent currencies for a RNG item I might not even use. Progression is meaningless but the gameplay is great as always.

Good graphics, skill branches showed potential. But leveling was too grindy. And gameplay required lots of micromanagement even on low difficulty, so zoning out during combat isn't possible, making the grind feel even harsher.
Love this game. Great mix of art and gameplay. Masterfully done!

First off, I want to give this a 5 star rating because I really want to support non pay to win and microtransaction games like this one. A rare find here and I really enjoy that. Otherwise my criticism would be to see cloud saves and a focus on character levels instead of party level in my opinion, the characters themselves would feel more special that way
Needs cloud support. You cannot change devices. My friend, I played multiplayer with all the time, had to uninstall to make room for updates of another app and lost all progress.

I liked Battleheart Legacy. This one has no story, very basic character development (there's just "party lvl"), and still difficult controls. I like the graphics, and I really appreciate no IAp's in game.
It's a great game, but feels unpolished. Where are the promised Cloud Save feature?
I'd like more missions
Finally! An updated Braveheart :') where's my achievements tho :' (

hello mikamobile I love this game it is fun and distinct with new spider and rat enemies including a goblin shamans it's fun and I wish you mikamobile would create another one but in all its Been awesome!.

A great sequel, but could be better. It's way too much of a grind. A few changes could go a long way. First, make crystals and skills purchasable with gold. Gold becomes useless if you continue playing beyond the final boss. Second, create more enemy types and make the entire world scale to your level after fighting the last boss. Third, make characters retaliate to ranged attacks. Lastly, allow the player to press and hold an enemy to order all characters to focus fire on it.
Way too grindy. Downloaded this a few months ago and just started playing today. Got bored of it quickly. Too bad. I was hoping for more. Really pretty game, though.
Very good game. I really like this game! Easy to play. Addictive. Can't put it down. Some levels are harder. Thanks
Not as good as the original! Just a grindfest for the most part. Old game mechanics were better as well. Wish more time went into the a story instead of updated art.
Mika Mobile is one of the best and under appreciated game developers for mobile. I love their games and this is one of the best RPG's I've ever played on a phone that wasn't a PS1 port.
best game on play store

Love the upgraded graphics of this one but still keeping it simple, I loved that charge from the original but other then that it kind of of feels like a rehash of the first BH, loved that you also kept it as a one off payment rather than iapps.
Mika could have done this game better. Seems like a cash grab and also copied all aspects of BH1. But on the other hand the gameplay is nice and the art is awesome.
Great pay-once game for on the train or before bed. Great range of party options and satisfying progression entertaining combat.
Good game. I just enjoyed Battleheart Legacy way more. Legacy is just more my style of game.
Even worse than battle heart 1... Disappointed cash grab trash game
Please add contents from the first battleheart
Even better than the first, by far

I loved the original, this game ilhas for some reason taken good parts and changed them for no good reason. For example you have party xp not individual characters l, but you can only upgrade one ability per level.
Excelent game, keeps me hooked up for hours!
Awesome game very addicting & hard to put down!
I've played since the original BH and have loved it and love what they've done with BH2. I would love to see more characters added in though, maybe some with helmets *hint, hint* 游땔.
Worst than first game.

Please please please.. update! This game is awesome! It takes elements from the first, which I also loved, and makes it even better. If you are looking for an offline fun game, this is it. Well worth the money! Mika, it's been too long, thank you for coming back! Please keep updating this time! Oh, and bring back the Archer! 游륋릦
Fun.
I can't play the game. After showing the "mikamobile" screen, it stops working and stuck at a black screen.
Great game. Wish there was support for the s pen on Samsung note 9.

Holy cow, this game is an utter tragedy. A beautifully robust, fun combat system, hamstrung by the complete lack of attention to multiplayer, storyline, or any social aspects at all. It's a huge shame that this game didn't sell better so the devs could've put a bit more effort into making it a more full product. As-is, it feels like a decent beta version of a game that was destined to be awesome.
I have tried BH series for both Andriod and IOS. Now I am a fan of it. I really want the multiplayer to be improved. TAKE MY MONEY

A really fun game with some weaknesses. The original Battleheart was, let's face it, a grind-fest as you worked to level up all your characters and get the items required to face the Big Bad. This sequel is even more of a grind, without the trappings of story and the occasional unlocking of a new character. That said, the grinding IS fun, the art is great, and the tactics can be challenging enough to keep your interest at the higher levels.
Recomendo 100%. A jogabilidade e os gr치ficos s칚o 칩timos. Confesso que ainda h치 melhorias a serem feitas, mas do jeito que est치 ja ganha 5 estrelas.

Let me start by saying I love Battleheart 1 and Battleheart Legacy. Despite Mika Mobile having a complicated relationship with Android the fact is we, the Android gamers, love them and their games! In fact, most if not all of the love this game is getting is because of those previous games. Unfortunately, Battleheart 2 is Battleheart 1 but with somehow more boring grind, worse sense of progression, worse story and some new glitches. I loved Battleheart 1, I think everyone did, the only problem with it was the controls and lack of content after a while. I think it wasn't hard to do a better job this time around but somehow it actually feels worse? Just had to take Battleheart 1, improve the assets (which you did very well), add content and other stuff to do and, most importantly, improve the controls - the main and almost only problem with the first one. With all the grind and dumbed down stuff in Battleheart 2 the only difficulty you'll find in this game is the controls. You will rarely die because of a tough boss or because you messed up, 99% of the time characters die because of bad controls or control-related glitches - they are the real villain of this game and it's extremely frustrating. Controls aren't the only issue though. Overall it sort of feels like a dumb remake instead of a real sequel. The only thing I love about this game is the graphics, the rest is just meh or plain bad. I won't talk much about the multiplayer - it just doesn't make any sense to me. This is 2018. There's so much more that could have been done. In my opinion it should be cut off and all resources focused on the game itself. I really hope the devs improve this game and add a lot more content like unlockable characters, class specializations and more stuff to do or manage between all the same boring brainless grind, because as it is I can't really recommend it, the feeling isn't right. Otherwise what I imagine will happen is the game becoming F2P soon with some of the characters locked behind paywalls and premium users getting them unlocked or something, but the fact is the characters are not even that remotely interesting or unique as it is. Let's hope they do a better job in the future supporting and improving this game and for Battleheart Legacy 2's sake.

So disappointed This is just a blatant re-hash of the original and after playing the brilliant battleheart legacy this just pales in comparison I feel pretty cheated by the devs having paid for this, I really thought this was going to be yet another step up from BHL and it was a massive step down. Mika, you can't just cram a game full of characters and expect gamers to be happy with that. I would certainly be reluctant to spend money on a Mika game in the future.
Improved art style from the already gorgeous original, and really brilliant controls and mechanics. But most importantly, it's just so damned cute.

I was disappointed at first that there is no story like in the previous Battle Heart, but I guess technically this is the successor of the very first one which also had just the battles. And after playing for many hours I think I don't even mind, I can always make up my own story as to why they fight 游뗵

I loved the previous battleheart games but this version has no storyline, new characters were very stale and it was full on grind. I was only able to grind so much until it got really boring. The grindy aspect would have been better if there was a larger customisable skill tree, or trinkets which you can combine, make new items or just something to not make the game so repetitive. Plus there was no archer. Saying this I wished there was a format like the first battleheart. In terms of storyline. I did enjoy this game during the first week but it got boring.

Got dozens oh hours in the 1st game and hundreds in the legacy version. Battleheart 2 seems unfinished compared to the previous 2 games, finished the last boss after 8 hours of playtime. Pros: -Smooth gameplay. -Loads of customisation options. -A great feeling of previous games. -No in app purchases. Cons: -Very little content compared to the previous games. -No storyline. -Where is the archer character? In conclusion this is the worst of the 3 Battleheart games by far. Gave 5 stars just to support the developer in hopes for a better game in the title.
Great time killer with NO in-app-purchases. Worth the price for sure.
This game desperately needs an autoplay feature. It's very very repetitive otherwise.
Since the last update the loading times for the battles have become insanely long. Unplayable. Uninstalling
Give some stories. Because it feel so repetitive.
Classic Battleheart but better! Wish there where more levels and better online play

Fantastic game. Customization only appears when you unlock all of a hero's active skills. I appreciate that they gave you every hero at the beginning but it's a bit overwhelming if you haven't played the previous games. UI is fantastic. Your heroes don't attack enemies back when ranged enemies hit them, so you can't start a battle and put your phone down and let it run on it's own. The game gets really grindy by the end and there's a lot less replay value than Legacy overall. Definitely worth the price. You should buy this game!

Huge fan since the first battleheart, best game on the Play store and have spent countless hours playing and replaying the game over. I've been hoping they released an update but they did better as released battleheart 2. Thank you to the Dev team for sticking with a one off payment and not pay-to-win like others. I would happily donate in order to you to keep of developing and improving on this game. Keep it up!
Not much story but the gamplay is awesome, i rarely find game this good to ki컄l some time
Really battleheart 1.5, and in some cases an oversimplification and step back

I dont mind a reskinned game with the exact same mechanics as the original. Thats what this game is. But the instant access to all characters, no story or intros, and a grind level progression cheapens the game. My biggest gripe is in the control schemes. Theres a lot going on at once yet characters will sit there doing nothing while being attacked. Brutal Street 2 has perfected the interface for these type of games, with auto targeting and attacking ranged characters, easy use of skills, and time slow down when issuing orders. I figured Battleheart 2 would imlliment these obvious quality of life changes in their interface, but no. Im still plagued with the same exact controls from the first game.
It is just a copy of BH1 with different art
Please make a Battleheart legacy 2 kinda thing 游땕
Improvement in graphics. Enjoyable.
The first Battle heart is amazing, and this game adds to it in everyway.
Having played loads of the original Battleheart, this is feels like a step backward.

*WARNING* This game has no cloud save or any save functionality if you delete the game or change devices. This is such a glaring and weird omission to have especially considering this is a game with a (relatively) large file size and is meant to be played for hours given its nature as an action RPG. So deleting the game is akin to stop playing it because I can't imagine why anyone would want to re-download it and start all over again.   Game is solid for what it is, but its hard to recommend based on this omission. Wish I knew that or else I wouldn't have bought it cuz if I did.
Super simple to get started with and succeed, but allows plenty of versatility that it does not feel stale after hours of playing. Great game to spend time on.
Waste my time and money
Huge fan of the original BH and BH Legacy, but this game feels like it's rushed, with almost no story, and shallow rpg elements. You can do better Mika, come on.

BH 1 and BH legacy were fun games. This feels like BH 1 without a story, without a sense of progression, and you're fighting the same battles over and over again. The passive skills are nice and let's you play around with different builds but its overshadowed by the fact that the entire party shares skill points. I don't think I'll replay it once I finish the game the first time.

In reality, this is Battleheart1.5, not 2. Essentially what the devs did was reskined Battleheart 1 giving it better graphics and changed level progression to be much more annoying. Skill points are now shared amongst the party so you now have to choose which character benefits from the grinding you have to do to progress. It is definitely what Battleheart 1 should have been but I was hoping for so much more from Battleheart 2. At least they made it a payed app instead of putting in-app purchases.
Great party RPG. Love that they added multiplayer. If you liked Battleheart 1, you will love this game. Way more in-depth with more items, the enchant ability, and more talents.
Battleheart takes the classic Tank/DPS/Heal mechanics of an MMO and distills them down into a fun mobile game.

Just... Meh.. Not much was done to improve from the first game. Feels much much more grindy now as well. Not bad.. But not great. Was hoping for more improvement from the first game. If your on the fence about buying this and already own the original... Don't. Just go replay battleheart 1. Wish I could get a refund

It's a good game, but when you introduced a multi player function that either crashes or doesn't want to connect it doesn't look good, single player amazing, but needs improving massively as I got it for the multi player function
The team selection page can be improve in a more convenient way, all other than are excellent

FOR THE DEVELOPERS I have been a big fan of the battleheart series since day one. I have enjoyed playing each one for countless hours of fun. Honestly though, I feel this one is missing something.... I think this needs a much more detailed story(or at least a story in general). It could use an auto fight mode, much like what the first one had. If a monster attacks one of my party members they should fight back. It would be cool to make the armor cosmetic much like how the weapons are. I'd spend much of the game grinding for better equipment only to see a number change..... I wish there were other types of party members. Like the paladin and ranger from the first one. But obviously more than just them. I think it'd be cool to add animal companions for each party member or maybe make it an unlockable skill for only a few. Definitely some different game modes. (Battle a dark version of your party, defeat all enemies within the allotted time, survive against an onslaught for an allotted time, etc etc) The party members shouldn't all be available right at the beginning. It seemed very lackluster.... maybe you could start with your first 2 like normal and then over time you have to save the other party members from enemy's who have captured them and copied some of their traits/abilities. I love this game, its great. But right now it's just a grinding game I use to pass the time. I love this series and see it so close to it's full potential everytime. I hope one day this game will get all the way there. And thank you Developer for making such great games for us!

The party based, real-time monster battling is top notch. Plenty of cool stuff in the equipment shop. The camp screen is optimized for ease of use. The world map gives you a few different choices each time, with highlighted rewards for each battle location.
A good sequel which inherits the core (both positive and negative) of the former one, but there's really no innovation compared to BH1. Besides, many bugs in multiplayer mode.
Bought because I loved the first game! Already in love with it.  Do you think you could throw in some battle statistics, like damage taken / done? Could really help in evaluating different strategies
Loved 1 , bought 2 to support dev
Sadly missing some of the original classes like monk. Not really a fan of the new system. But still but for support!

The other reviews are right. This is a step back from the first game, in every way except graphics, and you get a few different characters to choose from. It's fine if you really dug the first game and want something new, but the first game was better and you're better off just replaying it. Maybe with so many poor reviews they'll put some more work in and release an update so this is a real sequel, instead of just a bad remaster

I was hoping we'd be able to customize each character more, like in the first game where we could choose between two skills every five lvls, or be a bit more like Battle Heart Legacy, being free to choose what skills and weapons a character have. On the flip side I do like the new multiplayer option that was added.

Like BH 1, a genre-creating game, but better. While I like the 'map' less, I like that I can swap in new character classes without having to level them up -- but I will still have to 'skill them up'. Necro is insanely OP, a game-breaking class. Great 5* game!
SO disappointed. The game doesn't have the Ranger class. The game to me isn't even worth playing without this.
I love it, I have been waiting for this game for so long.

Feels like a reskin, wish they added stories, new modes, maybe skins? I love the first one, but this just feels too the same but different graphics. I was hoping for something more. Im hoping youre still working on this game , five dollars is worth alot here in my country

The game idea is quite good. But... 1. I have opened 8 legendary cache and all of them are weapons and only two of them are usable for my party. The others are from two weapons... No other items are available as the description said. 2. I suggest to show the heal and damage because I cannot feel the actual usage of the bonus from equipments. 3. The movement of the characters are quite slow. It makes the game more difficult and more boring. 4. I like skill trees more then the open choices for the talent.

Great game. Please implement two things: 1. Speed x2 and 2. auto fight. You could make those things purchasable. Otherwise, it's a fun game. Would be cool if you could spend your earned XP on your heroes to level them up. This way you could increase their stats a little bit.
Not as great as the original Battleheart.but still a must have if you want something unique and original that can be played in bursts during your free time.
Great follow up game. Like everything except the fact that individual characters don't level up. It uses a global level up instead.

Great game. And it is a grind, but for a change the grind is enjoyable, and not used as punishment for not buying micro-transactions. Battleheart 1 finished all too quickly so I welcome a long journey through the sequel. Well done the devs for keeping in-app purchases out of batleheart. Now all we need is a monk. Id pay for that

Great grinding game. I wish there was an option to chose the starting level 
at the arena. Perhaps you can make it so we can start at 50 levels less 
then what we have already cleared? It takes hours to get to level 1000.

I really enjoyed the first one and am enjoying the second one as well. I 
liked having separate character levels, and I was hoping for more classes 
than 12 which I'd probably pay for. Still love this game. Just feels like 
an expansion over a sequel.

Great game! Fun to play. Love the RPG element to it. Love that you can 
switch your characters whenever you want. Great graphics! Love some of the 
new characters and theabilities they have.
Another great game from Mika!

This game is same as first part. Not much changed for 5 years. There is no 
new idea, not even one. Buy it if you did not play first one.

I cant play across my different device. If I upgrade my phone, I will lose 
all my game progress. Make a fb or google play log in, so we can continue 
playing the same account on different device.

ive been following this game since BH1 & BH legacy. the graphics has 
improved. and i like the gameplay. there're so many class to choose, many 
party combination and also the strategy.its very fun game.

Incredible game played 20 hours on the first one and I'm at 25 hours and 
still playing really fun game good diversity.

Holy load times! No ability customization... it's the 1st game, except more 
pretty, horrible load times, and a more limited gameplay.

I don't mind a grind but... wow.. This game is unfortunately very dull. 
Shame as a lot of effort has gone into the various classes and talents, and 
graphics. Also just saved up for a legendary cache only for it to give an 
item that none of my chars can use. Grrr. 4 stars as i love Lost Frontier 
and respect you as devs (no microtransactions).

I'm really not sure why everyone loves this game so much.  There is no story and all you do is repeat the same thing over and over again.  You fight to try to improve your characters and gear and then do it all over again.  Maybe I'm missing something here or the game gets better but not sure I want to waste my time finding out.

I don't even think and just bought it. They have good reputation and good 
game design. Can developer also do something for battleheart legacy? Part 
2? Maybe? Please?

The core mechanics seem pretty solid. The game is fun enough as is. The way 
missions are selected feels very disjointed and unsatisfying - it never 
feels like you can even come close to staying on top of equipment and skill 
progression. Also even the "expanded" UI is insufficient. Larger autoattack 
range and skill indicators even just a bar with everyone's skills visible) 
would help a lot

What could have been a great sequel actually became a watered down version of the original (little to no background story, no sense of progression apart from advancing towards lv capped at 30,no google play integration, ridiculous loading times and occasional slowdowns). The passive skill system saves this game from being totally unoriginal - it gives player opportunity to try different class builds with option to respec. I can still recommend the game due to reasonable asking price, but if you consider BH1 or BH2, definitely go with original.

Gameplay is decent and everything seems great like the first one but the 
fact that any equipment equipped on your hero does not show up is a drag. 
It makes it seem like you're putting equipment on a first person character. 
The looks doesn't matter, it is just for the stats. It would be nice if we 
could see the equipment.

So happy this game is out on android. Noticed characters active skills have 
been slightly condensed in comparison to the first game. However, you are 
given a wide and open passive skill pool to choose from allowing you to 
bake extra utilities into your actives or add powerful skill combos. Sofar, 
enjoying the game. No microtransactions is a major plus. The Combat system 
is fun and the addition of extra extended hud elements to select heroes out 
of a chaotic brawl is a welcome addition if you so choose. My only gripes 
with the game is that it can feel grindy if you don't enjoy the combat and 
that rewards have been stretched thin with more randomness and a new 
separate crystal currency for upgrades. If you can convince some friends to 
purchase the game there is cooperative multiplayer. Allowing each of you to 
give full attention to a single hero. Allowing full use of cooldown resets 
and faster skill recharges. Overall, the game is great fun in short bursts 
and it's easy to lose hours in marathon sessions. There are even rumors of 
new classes to be added in future patches.

Absolutely phenominal! Everything I love in an rpg is right here with no 
bs! And oh MAN is the extended battle interface useful on higher levels. 
Really wish damage numbers was an option though, but thats just me & my 
love of minmaxing.

This game was an excellent follow-up to the original and I thoroughly 
enjoyed both games. Thank you Mika Mobile for making another fun game I 
will sink countless hours into!
I had lots of fun playing thiss

Pretty good reboot. Love the multitude of talents. I am missing some of my 
favorite classes, tho I am enjoying the new ones, I really really REALLY 
hope you guys drop Battleheart Legacy #2. Thx MikaMobile keep em coming.
Well done.

Loving the new features added to this sequel, especially the team exp. 
Makes trying new team combinations a lot more fun

Average at best. The controls are very frustrating and need a lot of work. 
The customization is lacking and a lot of characters play the same. The 
entire game is just a grind. Disappointing for a second entry in this IP.

I Played BH 1 and I just bought this because of that.. With no thinking. 
Shut up and take my Money

It's taken you 7 years to make a game that is worse than the original! I

Im disappointed, this is basically the same as the first game but somehow a 
step backwards. I was hoping for battleheart legacy with a team. The 
gameplay and mechanics are so solid u need to take this series in the

This sequal unfortunately does not live up to the hype of the first game. 
It's a re-skinned update to the first game with a few quality of life 
tweaks. There's absolutely no story whatsoever, the same exact enemies as 
the first, and mostly the same weapons/armor/trinkets. The worst part of 
this game is the lack of the sense of progression. You feel as though 
you're smashing your face into the same wall over and over, and there's 
never a destination to get to. I finished the game and just thought, "oh... 
I guess that was it." It's also incredibly grindy. Because there isn't a 
story or real levels, it just feels like you're playing the same level over 
and over in a massive grind. Overall it's a disappointing lazy sequal to 
the original game, and doesn't come anywhere close to being as enjoyable as 
BH1 or BHLegacy.

Was fun initially, but quickly ruined by the severe lack of incremental 
levels and no story development. Game quickly turns into "grind the same 
stages for better gear/skills and fight the boss" as opposed to playing the 
game and naturally progressing. Wish they left the grinding for the later 
stages of the game like most RPGs.

Its great to play a really well made game and not worry about pay to win. 
Mika has alway made great games. Excellent. More games please mika.

Pros: -No micro transactions. -Fun gameplay action wise. -More detailed 
stat screen. -Great graphics. Cons: -No customization for skills anymore. 
-No sense of progression which is a must in an RPG. XP is party based and 
not character based. This removes depth from the individual character and 
you just end up jumping between different ones. The entire level 
progression has been spaced out compared to the first game.

replyContent: We just submitted an update which should resolve the "white screen" issue some devices have experienced.  Please update and let us know if it doesn't resolve the problem via our support site at www.mikamobile.com

This game has no adds, no paywalls, no in-app purchases of any kind.  If I could give it more than 5 stars, I would.  Purchasing it once unlocks it for everyone using your family library.  This game is a true sequel to the original Battleheart game.  Four characters are controllable by the player and you can customize your party.  There are multiple tanks, healers, casters, and melee classes to pick from.    You can then take your characters through a wave-style battle where you must strategically manage combat.  Make sure your tank is picking up enemies, your healer is healing the right target, your damage dealers are prioritizing dangerous targets and your casters are using the appropriate control abilities to keep the fight pitched in your favor.    Each character also has three active abilities.  Each character also has a range of talents that can be unlocked using progressively more skill books.  There are 20 talents per character that can be unlocked.  Talents are passive abilities that subtly tweak the behavior of abilities, boost their power, or otherwise alter their effects or the characters attributes.
